wikipedia_page.main: Granville George Waldegrave, 4th Baron Radstock, CBE (1 September 1859 – 2 April 1937) was the son of Granville Waldegrave, 3rd Baron Radstock and his wife, Susan Charlotte Calcroft. He was educated at Repton School and graduated from Trinity College, Cambridge University, with a B.A. degree. He was invested as a Commander of the Order of the British Empire. He succeeded to the title of Baron Radstock of Castle Town, Queen's County, Ireland on 8 December 1913.  He died unmarried at the age of 77 and was succeeded in the peerage by his younger brother Montague Waldegrave, 5th Baron Radstock.
